message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.DS 

This paper deals with structured prediction in the context of machine learning, which is a topic that spans multiple sub-fields of computer science. However, given the focus on convex surrogate loss minimization and stochastic gradient descent, it is most likely to be categorized under cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses applications in computer vision (cs.CV) and natural language processing (cs.CL), which further support this categorization. The use of task losses and the analysis of optimization complexity suggest a connection to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Finally, the discussion of the exponential number of classes in structured prediction problems suggests a connection to cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms).
